updates.update_content: Hallelujah! Check out the email I got this morning:

We are making progress on fulfillment, but it is definitely more painful and expensive than ever. I've done my best to categorize each region below with the info that I have at this moment.  I'm so glad that many of you are starting to receive and enjoy your games!   

Asia
Australia

I am thrilled to announce that fulfillment is officially starting and being coordinated by Funagain Logistics around the world! When the label for your package is generated, you should receive a tracking number from them or their partners. For any issues with shipping or addresses in the USA/CAN, AU or Asia, please contact help@funagainlogistics.com directly. UK/EU backers should contact GamesQuest. If for some reason, they cannot resolve your problem, then you can reach out to us.

Asia

I'm titling this update part 1 because I know we will have another update with more details in the next few weeks.  Games have been arriving at ports and there are a lot of emails out there waiting for responses and updates on coordinating everything.  I expect to receive direction from Funagain Logistics on fulfillment very soon.  Last week, games for the EU and USA both arrived at port.  Tracking things from Ocean Freight to Warehouse is a bit tricky.  Typically, we don't get specific details until games have cleared customs and been received and unloaded at the warehouse.  We haven't gotten any receiving reports so far, but expect to get them this week.
I'm happy to report that I have much better news for this month's update.  Our Watch it Played video should be going live on their channel later this week.  Here's a sneak peek:

I'm going to start the update with all the bad news.  
Progress Update
It's been a pretty frustrating month.  I attended a 2.5 hour UK VAT webinar and learned practically nothing.  In fact, all it reinforced was that no one knows what's going on.  So I'm just not going to stress about it and we will see what happens. UK backers don't need to worry about it either, since the most I'll do is ask for some pity donations if I get royally screwed. I've never had to wait so long and pay so much for Ocean Freight.  It reminds me how much I hate this phase of the project, because all I can do is send emails and get increasingly frustrated.  The only positive to all of this, is that I've spoken to other publishers and this is a universal problem - one that is rumored to start clearing up after Chinese New Year.  Needless to say, I have never seen these types of delays and inconsistencies in ocean freight before.  Fulfillment may be very disjointed across regions because of this:

updates.update_userinfo: January Update: BGG's Most Anticipated Games of 2021!
updates.update_content:
Welcome to 2021, everyone! We hope your new year was full of joy and games! 
BGG - Most Anticipated Games of 2021
For the past several years, there has been a "Most Anticipated" list curated by fans on BoardGameGeek. Nominations are closing any day now and Lawyer Up is hanging onto its nomination by a thread, so we'd love your nomination and vote (just hit the thumbs up):

With the holidays, things have been very crazy trying to coordinate everything.  We are currently trying to book containers and ocean freight and hope to have the games on the water very soon.  I will do my best to provide ship names and time frames when we get all the shipping lanes straightened out.  It is our goal to start fulfillment in late January but that is very dependent on booking ocean freight which is apparently very stressed at the moment because of the holidays and COVID.
Estimated Timetable

BREXIT / VAT reckoning for the UK
Let me start off with some very bad news for UK backers going forward.  I just received freight shipping quotes and importing in the UK is 10x more expensive than importing into the EU.  We're talking ~$25 per copy of the game big.  I thought it was a typo and they added an extra zero.  After talking to 2 different UK fulfillment partners, I have discovered that not only was the quote correct but it's the result of some BREXIT policy changes with VAT calculation that start January 2021.  TLDR your government requires us to prepay 20% VAT on the MSRP.  That leaves us in the predicament of either shipping everything from the EU (and having you deal with VAT/customs/import etc) or figuring out a way to invoice and collect the VAT fees for each UK backer and then shipping from within the UK.  I'm currently investigating ways to best handle this unfortunate reality.  I feel the best result would be to figure out a way to invoice everyone in the UK for the VAT based on their order so it can ship UK friendly, but we could also just ship from the EU and see how it goes (no one really knows with BREXIT looming).  I'm open to suggestions on the best way to handle it, please feel free to comment and discuss below.

Last week we received our preproduction samples.  There was only 1 mistake with the factory printing some outdated cards in the Godfather expansion. We had sent them updated cards in August and I believe they just printed the old production files and missed updating them. They assured me they will correct this for the production run.  Otherwise everything looked absolutely stellar.

campaign.story:
What would Thucydides have to say about the Afghanistan War?  
Hi, I am John Lemay. I recently retired from the United States Army.  I served two tours in Afghanistan and two in Iraq as an infantry officer.  I am frustrated by the poor outcomes of both those wars - in great part because we repeated the mistakes of Vietnam.  The Vietnam generation did a fantastic job of recording the lessons of that war in books; yet those books had little impact on Afghanistan and Iraq.  The purpose of this project is to transmit lessons from the war in Afghanistan to current and future generations through video. 
To accomplish this, I will read The History of The Peloponnesian War, written by Thucydides, and consider how it applies to the Afghanistan War.  The History of The Peloponnesian War is divided into eight books, and I will make one video for each book.  In each video I will orient the viewer to the text and then I will let Thucydides' narrative draw out my experiences in Afghanistan.  By considering my combat tours through the lens of The History of The Peloponnesian War I will highlight some lessons that are relevant for future conflicts.  Below is my video from Book One of The History of The Peloponnesian War: 
What do you receive for backing this project?
You receive a subscription to my videos in a course format on the Teachable platform.  The teachable platform will enable you to watch the videos, read and download my notes on your web browser or on a phone app.  As a backer, you will receive an exclusive video not available to the general public and I will list you in the credits.  You will also receive any stretch goals that are unlocked - see the stretch goal section below.  Please be aware that I will make the core videos and notes available for free to the general public on YouTube, my website, and Facebook because I want to educate as wide an audience as possible about the war.
Who was Thucydides?  
Thucydides was an Athenian General who fought in the Peloponnesian War, the great Greek conflict between Athens and Sparta that lasted twenty-seven years, from 431-404 BC.  He was defeated by Sparta and then exiled by Athens.  He wrote his military history of the war as it happened, taking advantage of his exile to throughly research events. Because of the rigor he applied to his research, many believe Thucydides, and not Herodotus, is the Father of History, or they refer to Thucydides as the Father of Scientific History.  He is considered one of the great military philosophers.  Check out this white board "explainer" video about Thucydides:  
Thucydides Testimonials
 Thomas Jefferson wrote to John Adams in 1812: "I have given up newspapers in exchange for Tacitus & Thucydides, for Newton & Euclid; & I find myself much the happier."  Reference.
General of the Army George C. Marshall said in 1947: "[I doubt] whether a man can think with full wisdom and with deep convictions regarding certain of the basic international issues today who has not at least reviewed in his mind the period of the Peloponnesian War and the Fall of Athens.”  Reference.   
Stretch Goals
 FUNDED!!! $250 (funding goal) = Nine Videos & Notes.  If the project is funded you will receive access to the course that you purchased on Teachable  (Thucydides Ponders Afghanistan or Sun Tzu Ponders Afghanistan).  I expect to release them in early August.  Each course will include nine video talks and pdf notes to accompany them.    
 FUNDED! $500 = Google Earth Flyovers.  The geography of the Peloponnesian War can be confusing for modern readers.  If we reach this funding level I will produce eight google earth flyovers to highlight the key locations.  The flyover videos and KMZ files will be available in Teachable.  Check out my effort below (which will be much improved with funds for professional help!): 
PLAY

FUNDED! $750 =  Maps.  If we reach $750, I will add nine maps to help clarify key parts of Thucydides' narrative.  These maps will be available in Teachable.
 FUNDED! $1,250 = Infographics.  At this funding level, I will add nine infographics to illustrate some of my takeaways from the Afghanistan War.  These infographics will be available in Teachable. 
 $2,500 =  Podcasts.  If we reach $2,500, I will have someone(s) interview me about my video and record the interview.  The audio files will be available in Teachable, and I will also let you know where to find them on podcast software.
 $4,000 = Video Transcription to Podcast.  At this funding level, I will have the audio from my video transcribed into a podcast.  The audio files will be available in Teachable, and I will also let you know where to find them on podcast software.
 $5,500 = White Board Videos.  At this funding level, I will add nine white board videos to help explain key concepts from The Peloponnesian War or my lessons from Afghanistan.  These videos will be included in the Teachable course.  Below is an example that I made myself where I discuss a lesson from the Iraq War drawn out by Sun Tzu's The Art of War.
About John Lemay
I recently retired after serving 25 years and 7 months in the United States Army.  My career began at West Point and upon graduation I became an infantry officer.  I did two tours in Afghanistan and two tours in Iraq.  During my career I earned a masters of Peace Operations from George Mason University and a masters of Military Arts and Science from the Army’s School of Advanced Military Studies.  Now I am writing in my basement war room.

updates.update_content:
Team,
One of the United States Army's focuses during the Afghanistan War was to create, and latter "train, advise and assist" the Afghan National Army.  The doctrinal word for this activity is "Security Force Assistance."  Security Force Assistance is not a new concept - the Spartans practiced it brilliantly when Athens invaded Sicily.  The Athenians sent a huge expeditionary force to conquer the island.  The Spartans responded by sending a very small force to rally the Sicilians against their invaders.  The result - the complete destruction of the Athenian Expeditionary Force - changed the course of the Peloponnesian War, eventually resulting in Sparta' victory.  However, Sparta practiced "Security Force Assistance" very differently in Sicily than the United States did in Afghanistan.  The draft infographic below by Luis highlights some of the differences.

updates.update_userinfo: Remembering a Fallen Service Member on Memorial Day
updates.update_content:
Team,

When I was young, and even a young Soldier, Memorial Day was all about statistics.  For example, someone might say “Remember: 291, 557 American service members died in World War II to secure our freedom.” This changed dramatically during the Afghanistan and Iraq Wars because people I knew died. Now I remember those individuals specifically, take time to pray for their families and talk to my kids about them by name.

Team,
Here is a draft infographic in the same format as the "Spartan Strategy in the Peloponnesian War" one.  However, the United States' strategy in Afghanistan is much harder to discern than simply reading the King of Sparta's speech as recorded by Thucydides.  But I believe that President Bush's speech on April 17, 2002 at the Virginia Military Institute (VMI) illustrates the basic US strategy for the following 19 years.  At that point US operations in Afghanistan had transitioned from CIA / Special Forces "unconventional warfare" to conventional warfare.  President Bush then made a speech at VMI, where George C. Marshall graduated from, on the occasion of awarding the George C. Marshall Award to ROTC Cadets, and then went on to compare the US occupation of Afghanistan with the post World War 2 Marshal Plan for Europe.  The US strategy was to prevent terrorists from using Afghanistan as a base for operations by creating a new Afghan government that was a Republic allied to the United States and equipping it with a military capable of controlling Afghanistan's territory.   To accomplish this the United States would implement a "Marshal Plan for Afghanistan".

Team,

Thank you for the feedback!  Here is the updated Spartan Strategy Infographic.  I believe it is easier to read but has enough information to address a complex topic.  One major change was replacing the background map of Afghanistan with one of Attica - much more topical for this infographic.   Now Luis is working on a similar graphic - but for the United States Strategy in Afghanistan.

Team,
Here is the Peloponnese, David's last map.  The call out is the Island of Sphacteria where the Spartan contingent surrendered.  
Thucydides wrote "Nothing that happened in the war surprised the Hellenes so much as this. It was the opinion that no force or famine could make the Lacedaemonians give up their arms, but that they would fight on as they could, and die with them in their hands: indeed people could scarcely believe that those who had surrendered were of the same stuff as the fallen; and an Athenian ally, who some time after insultingly asked one of the prisoners from the island if those that had fallen were men of honour, received for answer that the atraktos—that is, the arrow—would be worth a great deal if it could tell men of honour from the rest; in allusion to the fact that the killed were those whom the stones and the arrows happened to hit." - Crawley, Chapter 12.

Team,
What do you think of this infographic?  Luis, the artist, thinks it is too crowded.  I'm reluctant to par down the words.
Thucydides goes beyond a dry recording of historical facts in his narrative by adding speeches from the key players.  As the Peloponnesian War begins Archidamus, King of Sparta, and Pericles, an Athenian Leader, both give speeches outlying war strategies.  However, Pericles dies early in the war and the Athenians largely abandon his, or any coherent, strategy.  The Spartans have significant problems in execution, but despite numerous tactical and operational defeats, they stick to their strategy.

Team,
Below is another fantastic map by David - The Chalcidice, Thrace and The Helespont.  Spartan strategy required two elements - controlling Attica with land forces and then controlling the Aegean Sea.  Sparta had the army to control Attica from the start of the war but it took them 27 years to achieve naval superiority in the Aegean.  In addition to building their own navy, they had to weaken Athens' navy.  There were two ways of doing this - the first was by winning naval battles.  But before the Athenian disaster in Sicily it was almost impossible for Sparta to defeat Athens at sea.  The second was by freeing Greek Cities from the Athenian Empire.  The Athenian Navy was enormously expensive and required the tribute of many Greek Cities to maintain.  It could be attritted by slowly depriving Athens of tribute.

Team,
Here is the first Thucydides Infographic by Luis!  Thucydides theorized that states go to war due to fear, honor and interest.  He argues that all the machinations between Corinth, Corcyra and Athens which proceeded Sparta's declaration of war on Athens was just pretext, and that the real reason Sparta declared war was fear of the growing power of Athen's Empire.

Team,

Here is a geographic orientation to the alleged grounds of the Peloponnesian War.  Thucydides believed this was all pretext and and that the real reason for war was Sparta's fear of Athen's growing power.  Today many refer to this as the "Thucydides' Trap" and argue that the United States' fear of China will inevitably lead to war.  However, I think the specifics matter.  Sparta voted for war after Athens, which had an eastern facing empire that dominated the Aegean Sea, moved westward into the Ionian Sea.  The equivalent would be China dominating the Pacific Ocean (which it does not, we have China boxed into the South China Sea and dominate the Pacific) and then moving into the Atlantic Ocean and threatening to cut sea lines of communication with Europe.

Team,
Here is the current draft of David's most recent map:  Attica.  The Spartans were able to dominate it by land, although they were never even tried to assault Athen's walls.  Athens dominated the coast and sea surrounding Attica.  Not shown on the map are the "long walls" that connected Athens to Piraeus.  Piraeus was Athen's port town and the Athenian Navy's home port.  Supplies, including critical grain, flowed into Piraeus and was delivered to Athens via a fortified route known as the "long walls".

Update  - April 6:
Due to the success of the campaign, the limited edition version of the deck has very low availability, so we are making the standard edition deck available as a reward and as an add-on. 
The standard edition will have the same cards inside but black ink on the tuck case and the seals will not be individually numbered.  You can add-on a standard edition deck to any pledge for $9 (includes shipping.) Limited edition decks are no longer available for add-on, but once we have an accurate account you still may be able to add-on one prior to fulfillment.
All the rewards with standard decks will have "standard" in the reward title. If it does not, the limited edition deck(s) will be included in that reward selection.
Standard Edition of the Deck
***
Introducing a precisely digitally hand-recreated reproduction of the first published complete transformation playing card deck in the world! The blue "Joan of Arc" deck is the first in a series of six famous decks we plan to release in 2020...  
The very first transformation deck issued by Cotta is from 1805. This deck is probably the most famous of all six, and is incredibly scarce. Original illustrations were fiddling artworks done by hand, on copper plates that were manually engraved with stipple and etching, and the cards were printed on linen period stock that was 97 mm x 69 mm in size, with blank card backs and squared corners at that time. Only the court cards were hand-colored, while the number cards used red stencils.
Cotta’s transformation cards were very successful and became a role model for later transformation decks from other publishers. And since the card backs were blank, individual cards were sometimes used by the nobility as visit cards and for leaving messages, so these playing cards often became multi-purpose items.
There are many historical values in the series of decks! But if you are only interested in the deck details & images instead of history & backstory, then please skip about half way down.
 The story behind these playing cards, which probably conceal the most of the world's playing card secrets, begins in Tübingen, a city in southwest Germany.
The atmosphere here is bursting with memories and experiences of the past. Visitors today can still enjoy the small stairs, narrow alleys, and pointed gables that shape the silhouette of old Tübingen on the way to its famous castle. Tübingen is home to one of Europe’s oldest universities and even today combines the colorful bustle of an university town full of students with the flair of a restored medieval center and a touch of many ancient cultures. The Romans already left some traces of their presence here in AD 85, but the city itself dates from the 6th or 7th century. Little wonder that this city attracted many eminent notables and artists, who found it inspirational for their work. 
 The idea behind the concept of Cotta's transformation decks was to create a series of six decks on an annual basis from 1805-1811. Each deck would focus on a different theme, with the first set based on Schiller's play Jeanne d'Arc, which was about the famous historical figure Joan of Arc. 
Forming a "Card Almanac" (Karten Almanach), each card in the deck would represent one of the 52 weeks in a calendar year. At the time it was popular to print various almanacs, which were special pocket books for the new year, and often included a short poem or quote for each week of the calendar year. It was a logical move to connect each of these 52 weeks with a playing cards.
Johann Friedrich Cotta (*April 27, 1764 - December 29, 1832), publisher, industrial pioneer, and politician, the man at the helm of family publishing house J. G. Cotta (founded yet in late 17th century by his grandfather Johann Georg Cotta *1631 - 1692) from Tübingen, Germany, around 1804 went on to produce a series of six playing card almanacs in successive years from 1805-1811, with a new deck appearing in all but one of those years. 
In addition to Johann Friedrich Cotta's high standing as a publisher, he was a man of great practical energy, which flowed into various fields of activity, he promoted even many reforms and supported talented individuals. It is also noticeable that in such period of his life he published numerous works of his own literature, political materials, and also yearbooks.
Cotta did have the goal of replacing the "inelegant" designs of contemporary German playing cards with a more artistic high-quality deck. But these playing cards were not intended for playing games with in the first place, but rather for stimulating discussion about the "themed" images on each of the cards. Each year the court cards were designed to represent another theme, while the number cards featured pictures that were largely independent drawings without a common topic, since they were especially intended as conversation pieces and depicted happenings.
The Cotta's famous house was the place, where among other brilliant German authors of the time, the works of Schiller and later of Goethe were published there in its journal pages, as well as journal's major contributor was Heinrich Heine, who with his early lyric poetry has inspired even composers such as Robert Schumann and Franz Schubert who set his works into music... 
So the picture that emerges from this time in Cotta's life is that he was constantly engaged in thoughtful conversation with literary men, and enjoyed close friendships with leading figures of the day like Schiller, Huber, Gottlieb Konrad Pfeffel, and others, many of whose works he published.
Johann Friedrich Cotta's long term friendship with the famous German poet, dramatist, philosopher, and historian Friedrich Schiller was well known. In 1795 Schiller and Cotta founded the Horen, a periodical that became important for students of German literature. Schiller's goal was to use his work to infuse higher ideas into the common lives of men, by giving them a nobler human culture, and “to reunite the divided political world under the banner of truth and beauty.” It was as a result of this relationship that Goethe became part of a close circle of friends with Cotta and Schiller. Even today there is evidence at Cotta's house of Goethe having slept there. 
It is probably this friendship that gave birth to the idea of creating a unique decks of transformation playing cards with the purposes of igniting discussion about the "themed" picture on each card. This was after all a time when people were open to such ideas, and producing a series of playing cards as almanacs for a continuous period of years was a natural development.
With help from you the backers we plan to produce the entire 6 deck series! The color of each tuck box created by Azured Ox has been inspired by Goethe's experimental optic and color theory, since Goethe was an important contemporary of Cotta, along with Schiller. (Goethe's deepest immersion into colors was during Cotta's decks issuing.)
Limited Edition Decks
Standard Edition Decks
Goethe’s spent years on his theory (built on wavelength theory of light broken into 7 colors demonstration after Newton), which became a personal obsession in his last years, and which he considered more important than his literary works.
Goethe believed that colors arise from the interaction between light and darkness, light and dark edges along the spectrum; that colors are realities, phenomena of nature... His color theory was intended to be a paradigmatic model for natural science in general, and Goethe was concerned with the psychological effects of each color, as well.
He believed that colors symbolize different values and that colors have a clear effect on the mind and feelings. Goethe had little use for concepts of divinity or for systematic thinking. His theory formulated a psychological and philosophical account of the way we actually experience color as a phenomenon.
Much of historical happenings, influences and activities would later find a place in the Cotta decks, including events in the life of Cotta's own family and of notable figures like Schiller and Goethe. Other important influences include the literature, art, history, politics (e.g. Napoleon's invasion), and religious reforms of the time, which all served as an important context to shape the art in the decks themselves. 
For example, Schiller experienced a grave illness that led to his death, and this around as well as many more is even depicted in the playing cards from the Cotta decks. In short, there is significant evidence of such connections between the artistic pictures and the immediate context that produced them.
It is especially significant for the way it displays meaningful and inspirational happenings from the time; in this first deck, such as Schiller on his death-bed (Six of Clubs) or sadness of Goethe (probably depicted on Nine of Clubs), assumed depictions from life of noble families, etc...
 First almanac deck: Jeanne d'Arc (Year 1805) 
The images on the court cards are characters inspired by Schiller's play "Die Jungfrau von Orleans" ("Joan of Arc"). 
The central figure of Joan of Arc is depicted as the Queen of Spades, the Maid of Orleans who inspired the French army to victory, but was later burned at the stake.

52 Cards + 2 Extra Jokers + 2 Extra Collectible Cards

Digitally Hand-Recreated and Designed by Azured Ox
 Produced By Will Roya 
Cotta's first deck was designed by Countess Mary Day von Jennison-Walworth (sometimes spelled with a single `n'). Her maiden name was Beauclerk, and she was the wife of Count Francis Jenison Walworth (1764–1824). She was an illegitimate (twin) child who led a very colorful life, and finally settled down somewhat after marrying Count Francis in 1797. (Probably, she was creating illustrations in Stuttgart.)
We are limiting this 1st deck to only 1,000 copies with numbered seals. We may print a small amount additional decks without seals to meet demand or for a special edition. 
The entire 6 deck series is in many ways designed by Azured Ox to meet collector's demand (as "collection of historical books") and will be produced with the piece of puzzle image on each tuck spine (left side of box) to create together nice display of the Tuebingen monument surroundings, where the idea for Cotta's decks was born. 
The publisher's name was placed on the Ace of Clubs as follows: "A Tubinge chez J. G. Cotta, Libraire."
The transformations on the number cards have no reference to each other or to the court cards (as well lots of them might be considered as unexplained mystery).
The court cards were designated with the words "Valet", "Dame", and "Roi", which are the French terms corresponding to the Jack, Queen, and King.
In the first deck, beside Joan of Arc depicted as the Queen of Spades, other individuals closely associated with Joan include Etienne de Vignolles or La Hire (Jack of Hearts), who helped Joan to victory in the battle of Patay in 1429; and Raymond (Jack of Diamonds), a peasant who was Joan's page.
Key political leaders who figured prominently in the events surrounding Joan's life are also represented, including King Charles VII (King of Hearts), the French monarch who relied on Joan's help to reach the Rhiems, the traditional place of coronation; Charles' mother Isabeau (Queen of Hearts), who was in league with Charles' enemy; Charles' mistress Agnes Sorel (Queen of Diamonds); Charles' opponent Philippe the Good (King of Diamonds), an ally of England; and the king of Naples, René d'Anjou (King of Clubs), who lost the kingdom after defeat in battle. General Talbot (King of Spades) was the English commander of the outpost of Orleans at Saint Loup, who was wounded in battle, captured, and was part of a prisoner exchange.
Both Joan's "sister" Louison (Queen of Clubs) and Montgomery (Jack of Clubs) are fictional creations of Schiller, while the fictional Lionel (Jack of Spades) is the character who holds up Joan's sword in a location revealed by the voices that she supposedly heard telling her to help.
 Clubs: Montgomery, Louison (Joan's fictional sister), René d'Anjou (King of Sicily)

Hearts: Etienne de Vignolles (La Hire), Isabeau de Baviere (Charles' mother), Charles VII (King of France)

Also we thought it could be interesting to put another illustrations from the far past on the additional extra cards, in respect to year almanacs, we came with an idea of twelve calendar months in the series as exclusive collection of unique historical artworks...

Let's dive now into the deepest imagination and fears of the ancient Greek civilization with "SKOTOS" (σκότος from Ancient Greek "Darkness" ) :
 Silenus was the old rustic god of wine-making, companion and tutor to the god Dionysus. It was believed that he acquired arcane knowledge and was able to predict the future. He plays an important role in the myth of King Midas and his lust for gold.
 The Sphinx was sent by the gods to plague the town of Thebes as punishment for some ancient crime, preying on its youths and devouring all who failed  to solve her riddle. She's involved in the infamous myth of the Theban prince Oedipus.
 Every day this giant wild boar would come crashing down from his lair on the mountain of Erymanthos, attacking men and animals all over the countryside, gouging them with its tusks, and destroying everything in its path. It's connected to the myth of the Twelve Labours of Heracles.
 The Aetos Kaukasios is a giant eagle that was summoned by Zeus to be used in the punishment of Prometheus. Prometheus was chained to the top of a mountain so that every day the Eagle would fly to him and eat out his liver. Since he was immortal, his liver would regrow and would be eaten out the next day.
 She was a Gorgon, a chthonic female monster, and a daughter of Phorcys and Ceto. Gazing directly upon her would turn men to stone. She was beheaded by the hero Perseus, using the sword Harpe, who thereafter used her head as a weapon until he gave it to the goddess Athena to place on her shield.
 Cerberus the three Headed Dog was the multi-headed dog who guarded the gates of the Underworld, preventing the dead from leaving, and making sure that those who entered never left.
It's a monstrous lion and could not be killed with mortal weapons because of its golden fur which made him impervious to attacks. The creature's claws were sharper than conventional swords and could cut through any armor. It was slain by Heracles as part of the first labour, which earned him the Nemean Lion's hide.
The Chimera is a mixed beast from Greek lore whose body typically consists of various bits of a lioness, a goat, and a serpent. It is known to breathe fire while the snake portion is venomous.
 The Cyclops Polyphemus was encountered by Odysseus and his crew, and instead of helping them, he ate and killed various members of the crew and trapped the rest in his cave. When Polyphemus slept, Odysseus blinded him with a wood stick in retaliation of what he did.
 Chiron the Centaur was notable for his youth-nurturing nature. His personal skills tend to match those of his foster father Apollo, who taught the young centaur the art of medicine, herbs, music, archery, hunting, gymnastics and prophecy, and made him rise above his beastly nature.
 Its lair was the lake of Lerna in the Argolid. Lerna was reputed to be an entrance to the Underworld, and archaeology has established it as a sacred site older than Mycenaean Argos. In the canonical Hydra myth, the monster is killed by Heracles as the second of his Twelve Labors.
 He was the offspring of the Cretan Queen Pasiphae and a majestic bull. Due to his monstrous form, King Minos ordered to build a huge maze known as the Labyrinth to house the beast. The Minotaur remained inside receiving offerings of youths and maidens to eat. He was killed by the Athenian hero Theseus.
 Pegasus remained a mysterious creature capable of everything, symbolizing the divine inspiration or the journey to heaven, since riding him was synonymous to “flying” to the heavens. It was represented as a goodhearted, gentle creature, somewhat naive but always eager to help.
For his service and loyalty, Zeus honored him with a special immortality turning Pegasus into a constellation on the last day of his life.
PIPS of Skotos are inspired by genuine ancient Greek symbols discovered on pottery Art, Shields and Armours decorations.
To stick with ancient greek aesthetic, I have chosen the Orange/Red Cinnabar and Brown Sienna colors to contrast with a slight Pentelicus marble effect. To embellish and balance the Design, each card is represented with two Ionic columns with the respective greek number on top of it.
This superb tuck box illustrates ancient Greek Patterns and symbolism such as Greek Keys, Waves of the Mediterranean sea, Flowers and Sun decoration.
You also notice the shield looking part with the capital Lambda (Λ) referring to Λακεδαίμων, which was the Hellenic name of the Spartans. Athenians did the same thing, putting an alpha (Α) on their shields as a symbol for Athens Ἀθῆναι.
 As you can see the overall look is directly inspired by the distinguished ancient "Red-Figure" Art, one of the most important styles of figural Greek painting. I have chosen Premium Amber Foil and Shadow Black Paper to render this authentic aesthetic for SKOTOS | Amber Foil unlocked with Stretch Goal #1 [SUCCESS] 
 The cards back let you appreciate a meticulous sense of detail with Greek Keys, Waves of the Mediterranean sea, Flowers, Sun, the renowned Laurel Wreath and the enigmatic maze structure designed to hold the Minotaur : The legendary Labyrinth of Knossos | Amber Metallic Ink unlocked with Stretch Goal #2 [SUCCESS]

campaign.story:
The details of my life are quite inconsequential....
In 2018 my friend and I opened our own little independent pharmacy in a small Nebraskan town (Hickman). As a way to bring a smile to the faces of our customers, I learned a few VERY SIMPLE card illusions ("tricks are what whores do for money" -Gob Bluth). During the process I fell in love with playing cards, magic, and cardistry. Short story long, I talked to some WONDERFUL individuals (including Brendan Hong and Gio aka Thirdway) and they inspired me to create a deck for the pharmacy. I reached out to an incredible illustrator, Russell Gray, and after almost a year of brainstorming and countless adjustments, we created the Meadowlark Deck. I hope you enjoy it as much as we do.
If you find yourself in Lincoln (Nebraska), I encourage you to take a 10 minute detour south and visit the pharmacy. I would love to see your cardistry moves and card illusions!
QUICK OVERVIEW:
Printed by United States Playing Card Company on Art of Play trademark stock and finish
 Metallic Copper Ink 
Fully CUSTOM Back Design, Court Cards, Pips, Aces, and Jokers
Fulfillment by Art of Play 
Shipment estimated to begin in October 2020 
 GIVEAWAYS!!!! Follow @meadowlarkdecks on Instagram
**NOTE: All images are renderings. Final product is subject to change**
******** UPDATED April 12, 2020 ********
LUXURY EDITION NOW AVAILABLE!!!!
The cards will be printed by Cartamundi. The card backs will be cold foiled with yellow gold (replacing the yellow of the standard card back). The tuck box will be printed in Greece by Lotrek (Oath Playing Cards) and will be double foiled (with yellow gold and copper foil). The bottom of the tuck box will be hand numbered. This edition will be limited to no more than 400. The price for the Luxury Edition deck will be $35.
CUSTOM HALF-BRICK BOX UNLOCKED!!!! 
Copper foil on a black paper with a small amount of white to bring it all together. For every 6 decks that you pledge, it will be shipped in one of these half-brick boxes. For example, if you are a "Full Brick" tier backer, then you will receive 2 half-brick boxes with 6 Standard Edition decks each. If you are a "Triple Deck" tier backer and add on 3 of the Deluxe Editions (unlocking soon?), then you will receive 1 half-brick box containing 3 Standard Edition decks and 3 Deluxe Edition decks.  If you have any questions, please feel free to ask.
DELUXE EDITION UNLOCKED!!!!
Copper foil on a black paper stock with the yellow and white as the accent colors. Inside will be a yellow gilded deck! We are doing our best to match the yellow from the deck with the gilding, so it might be more of a yellow gold to make sure that it is shiny (see render below). The Deluxe Edition decks are available as an add-on for $30 per deck.
****Remember! The Deluxe Edition Deck will be added for FREE as a 13th deck for all "Special Brick" Tier backers.

________________________________________________________________________________

BACK DESIGN
The poker-style back design intended to take the Bicycle Rider Back and give it a retro yet modern feel. The Meadowlark was drawn in a fashion to be cohesive with the rest of the deck including the court cards, Ace of Spade, and Jokers. The back design is perfect for magicians, cardists, poker players, and art enthusiasts alike.
COURT CARDS
The goal with the court cards was to give the traditional courts a modern update while maintaining a retro feel. Keeping with the theme of Meadowlark Pharmacy, we mixed some subtle (and some less subtle) items into each court card. We hope that you enjoy finding them as much as we enjoyed adding them.

JOKERS
Truth be told, the jokers were one of the hardest things to nail down. There were multiple versions, but when Russ sent me these I was so excited that we had the perfect jokers for the deck.
I mean... how cute are these guys?! Am I right?????
ACES
The number cards will have a standard layout with custom pips (we got a little crazy with the prototype). For the Aces we wanted to continue to tie together the rest of the deck, making it feel custom yet functional. Which one is your favorite?

TUCK BOX
The tuck box will be a matte finish stock with embossing as seen in the picture below. These custom tucks will be produced by Clove Street Press.
STRETCH GOALS (UPDATED)
 $9,000 [UNLOCKED] = Upgrade tuck box to have copper foil replace the copper ink
 $12,500 [UNLOCKED] = Custom Half Brick Boxes and Seal (see pictures below)
 $15,000 [UNLOCKED] = Deluxe Edition with gilded deck will be available as Add-On for $30 per deck 
 Giveaways will be held (more info on Instagram so follow us @meadowlarkdecks)

ADD-ONS
Posters and Postcards:
Shashin with Masuta Design (@masutadesigns on IG) has designed a beautiful "RX" poster! I just received the postcard sized prototypes for the 2 posters we will offer and I LOVE THEM. The posters are 11x17 and will be numbered and signed. Each poster is limited to 25 and will cost $25 (for USA) and $28 (for International). The postcards will come as a set of 2 (one of each) and will be $8. You can add these on by managing your pledge and adjusting the pledge amount accordingly.  Please be sure to message me so I can keep a total count of the posters sold and let everyone know when no more posters are available.
Here is the Postcard Sized Prototype of the RX Poster (playing card added in picture to show scale)
Here is the Postcard Sized Prototype of the Initial Design of the King of Hearts (playing card added in picture to show scale and final design)
Deck Protector created by Retro Rocketeers:
This is a full wrap deck protector made from Eco-friendly Bio-plastic and hand finished with gold leaf paint. The edges are beveled for extra comfort in your hands and when carried in your pocket. The deck (including tuck box) slides in from the top and the bottom has a hole so you can push the deck up and remove it easily. The pictures don't do it justice but I hope that you can at least get an idea. The cost is $25 and can be added by simply clicking on "Manage your pledge" and adding $25 onto your total. Please message me after this to inform me that you are adding one onto your pledge so I can make sure that I have all the proper information during fulfillment.
Additional Decks:
Would you like more Standard Edition decks? Really?!?! WOW!! Thank you!! Simply add $15 onto your current pledge. This will include shipping, so no need to add more than that. If you want more than that please message me and I will let you know how much to add (will give a little discount with multiple decks).
**If you have any troubles or if you have any questions, please message me and I will be happy to assist you**
Fulfillment
Fulfillment will be handled by Art of Play. They are efficient and do everything they can to keep the delivery costs as low as possible while assuring the playing cards are well protected. I mean they got this on lock!

updates.update_content:
Hey Friends, 
I hope that you are all having a wonderful day! Our next campaign has just launched, and if you are interested, please click on the picture below.

Hey Friends!
The time has come for all the remaining fulfillment to be completed. Thank you all so much for your patience! Art of Play had an amazing turnaround on assembling all the Deluxe Editions and are hard at work completing all of the remaining orders. Please make sure to check your email to find your tracking number.

Hey Friends!
I just received an email from Art of Play with some great news! The gilding company just finished gilding and will be shipping the decks back to Art of Play. I have been assured that our project is at the top of the list for priority and that they will begin to assemble all of the decks as soon as they arrive. Once completed, the final stage of fulfillment will begin and as the orders go out, you will receive an email with your tracking number.

Hey friends!
I wanted to touch basis with you since the last update was about a month ago. The gilded decks were supposed to be finished last week, however I received a message from Art of Play on Sunday informing me that the decks were not ready. Here are the exact words from the email:

Hello my friends!
Here is a quick update:
Some of you should be receiving email from Art of Play with tracking information on your packages.
The fulfillment of orders that consist of only Standard Editions started to be shipped on Friday.

Hey Friends!
I hope that everyone is safe and well. We are entering our final phase before fulfillment begins, so I wanted to give you a small update:
 Half Brick Boxes: These are completed and at Art of Play. 
 Deluxe Edition: The decks are at the gilder's facility. Upon completion, the decks will be shipped back to Art of Play. The tuck boxes are finished and just waiting for the decks.

Hey Friends!
Thank you for your patience. I know it has been awhile since the last update. I finally have some information to share, so here we go:
1) Gilding- There has been a change in color for the gilding from yellow to copper. I was under the impression that all foil could be used for gilding; however, there are only certain types of foil that can be used and not all of those foils are reliable. I apologize for my ignorance and for my broken promise of yellow gilding. I have worked continuously with the gilders and Art of Play regarding foils and what we can use (ie- different gold colors), and after multiple failures, we decided to go with a copper gilding. Overall, I truly feel as though it looks better than the yellow and is more cohesive with the tuck box. Here is a render of the gilding to give you an idea:

Hey Friends!!!
It has been awhile since the last update so I wanted to keep you all in the loop.
1. Standard and Deluxe Edition: USPCC confirmed with Art of Play that we are scheduled for print this week.  This means that Art of Play should be receiving the decks around the beginning of August. Clove Street Press is aware of this progress and will be printing the tucks around this timeframe. Clove Street will be printing the Standard Edition Tuck, Deluxe Edition Tuck, Half Brick box, and Tuck Seals. This will allow us to have a consistent color throughout the decks (specifically the foil colors).

Hey friends!
Just a quick update today:
1. We made the cut off for the current Cartamundi run, so we should have the decks printed by the end of July. 
2. Lotrek is super busy and continues to tease us on IG about his secret deck. He is planning on having the tucks done by the end of June.

Hey Friends!
I just wanted to give you an update on where we are with production. If this is too much information or does not interest you, then please disregard.
 Surveys: We are at 92% completed. YAY. Thank you to everyone who filled theirs out. I have received some constructive feedback about it and I apologize to everyone if the surveys were confusing or cumbersome. If you have any questions or concerns please don't hesitate to contact me. Next campaign I will utilize BackerKit to allow people to add-on and manage their pledge post-campaign. Kickstarter unfortunately does not allow this to occur, so if you are wanting to purchase other items post-fulfillment, I will have them available on a website (currently in the process of making a website with some friends). More info to come.

campaign.story:
Welcome back everybody! The first launch of this kickstarter was unfortunately unsuccessful, but I am optimistic that we can make to the goal this time! 
The Beekeeper's Playing Cards
The Beekeeper's Playing Cards is a custom, fully illustrated poker card deck which I have been designing on and off for the past two years. What started out as four prototype card designs for a class assignment has become an amazing journey of learning and experiences. Now that I have finished every hand-painted illustration, I am overjoyed to finally have the opportunity to share them with you!
Why bees?
The fuzzy little creatures that buzz around in your garden are often overlooked as just another stinging pest. Many people just assume all of  the yellow and black-striped insects are out to get them, when really, they are all different and each play an important role in the ecosystem. Honey bees, one of the leading pollinators, are crucial to the  environment, but their population is declining. I hope to spread awareness of the significance that these adorable flying fluff-balls hold for our survival.
The Cards
Every card in the deck contains a detailed illustration, hand-painted in watercolors.
Each individual illustration was carefully planned and designed to thoroughly represent its assigned card.
The King features the worker bee, as they are the ones truly in control of the colony. All female, these worker bees have the power to overthrow the queen and raise a new one, if they so desired.
The Queen is, of course, the queen bee. She is the most important bee in the hive, as she is the only one who can lay fertilized eggs, which create worker bees.
The Jack is represented by the Drone. The only males in the hive, the drones' primary function is to mate with the queen.
Each Ace features a different style of man-made bee hives used by beekeepers throughout history and around the world.
The types of honey bees
The four suits have been redesigned from the traditional pips to represent different plants that honey bees love to frequent. Each number card features its suit's plant, with its respective number of bees and corresponding flowers for them to pollinate.
The Diamonds have been re-imagined as crimson clover.
The Hearts are made up of crocuses.
The Spades have become the blossoms of teasels.
And finally, the Clubs, which are envisioned as white clover, complete the set.
Diamonds
Hearts
Spades
Clubs
On the Joker cards is "The Busy Bee", who spends all of her time making delicious honey.
Joker
On the back of the cards is a honeycomb pattern. This will be printed right to the edges, so there will be no white space or margins. 
Back of cards
Each deck of cards will come in its very own tuck box.
Tuck box cover
Manufacturing
The cards will be professionally made in the USA by The United States Playing Card Company. For more information on the company, you can visit their website at https://usplayingcard.com/about-us/
Other Backer Rewards
For the reward tiers that include signed artwork prints, here are some examples of what they may look like. Frame styles and colors may vary, depending on availability in the coming months, but I will try to keep them as close to the samples as possible. The frames will all have a wood-grain finish, and the prints will be matted. The prints will be full size of the original illustrations (aside from the worker and drone bees, which will be scaled to the correct ratio next to the queen. The queen, however, will be full sized, measuring about 3 inches tall), making them about 20-30% larger than what is on the cards. The largest of the illustrations, "The Busy Bee", measures about 4 inches in height.
The Busy Bee sample
Hives sample
Honey Bees sample
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with viewing anything online, colors may vary from the physical product. This is due to different devices having different color settings, as well the fact that computer screens display color using light (RGB), while printers create color using pigment (CMYK). I will do all I can to keep everything as true to the original colors as possible, but unfortunately that is the nature of reproducing traditional artwork.

Other risks that are beyond my control may include delays in manufacturing, delayed shipping, or product damage in shipping. Each product will be carefully packaged to ensure safety while shipping, but in the case that damage does occur, contact me and I will replace it.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Go Where No One Has Gone Before with The Mars Atlas
  The Mars Atlas is the first of its kind publication containing stunningly detailed maps of the entire Martian surface. Designed by a team of astrocartographers, the Atlas lets you unleash your inner explorer and learn about the Red Planet til your heart’s content. No longer science fiction, now you can discover Martian mountains, valleys, and riverbeds  - many of which are still unnamed.
From Cover to Cover, We Made Every Page Count
218 masterfully created topographic maps of the Martian surface
  Detailed introduction on the history of Martian exploration
  An alphabetized index of over 2,000 named places and geographic features
  Locations of historic and future human landing sites
  Comprehensive index map to guide readers to areas of interest
  Standard cartographic elements such as scale-bar, north arrow, and projection
  A carefully selected quote from the late astrophysicist Carl Sagan printed on the back cover
  A synopsis of what it takes to map a planet from scratch
  A personalized message from the RedMapper Team
  A special Thank You page commemorating Kickstarter Pledgers who helped us get The Mars Atlas to print
  Mars Portal access: Use Mars Portal alongside The Mars Atlas 
Track the Evolution of The Red Planet with Mars Portal
Imagine if we had satellite images and maps of a pre-human Earth. With Mars Portal, a web-based map of the entire planet of Mars, we now have that capability with our Red neighbor.  An online community with features similar to Google Maps, you can use Mars Portal along with The Mars Atlas to learn about the planet, its history, and its future.
Mars has never been more accessible to explorers, students, and enthusiasts alike. Go off-world with The Mars Atlas and Mars Portal as your guides. You now have unprecedented passage to humanity's next frontier:
PLAY

Zoom in on the Curiosity Rover's path and the landing site of Viking. Glide over the water-filled polar ice caps.
Traverse the majestic cliffs of Valles Marineris. Dive into calderas atop Olympus Mons⁠—the largest mountain in the solar system (more than 2x the size of Everest).
Although the Atlas is designed as a tabletop reference book, it contains the most up-to-date map data available as it draws from data collected by NASA's previous Mars missions and orbiting satellites. It is the comprehensive cartographic representation of the Martian surface.
With The Mars Atlas, you can examine the actual places on Mars that appear in research, the news, and popular writing. Learn where these places are, their relative location to one another and plan your future adventures!
The sweeping plains and colossal cliffs of the Red Planet are clearly visible in the red-to-blue elevation relief with accompanying topographic lines. Use the alphabetized index to find more than 2,000 features and places already named including mountains, craters, valleys, and plains.
Step into Mankind's History on The Red Planet
Since 1971, international space agencies have sent at least 14 artificial objects to the surface of Mars, including the in-operation Curiosity rover and InSight lander. Retrace their steps (and tracks) with precision and follow along as new explorers arrive:
Preview the Journey for NASA's Mars 2020 Rover
Launching this summer and arriving at the Jezero Crater in February 2021, the Mars 2020 Rover will search for ancient signs of life in the rocky sediment. Study its landing zone in The Mars Atlas and visit its new home in Mars Portal!
 Our Mission for The Mars Atlas and Mars Portal 
The Mars Atlas was born out of the idea that if you're going to land a ship, construct a colony, or travel on Mars, you need to know where you are going.
Here in the 2020s, we're globally set on going to Mars; so what better time to introduce accessible maps for our increasingly space-conscious society?
It is our hope that The Mars Atlas and Mars Portal result in an increased awareness and contextual understanding of Martian geography, resulting in impactful conversations that benefit our drive to go there.
It is our intention to deliver these tools in the form of detail-rich illustrations and immersive experiences so any generation can access and enjoy the journey to Mars.
It is, after all, our collective destination.
Pushing the Boundaries of STEM Education
Our development team built The Mars Atlas and Mars Portal on the premise that every person should have access to space. We are inspired by the idea that young students will pick up a copy and have an appreciation for space exploration ignited within them as we were with some of the greatest milestones in our history. Perhaps one of these students will go on to play an active role in the settling of the Red Planet.
 Meet the Astrocartographers 
Three years ago, our founder Eian Ray had the honor of participating in an exercise to map NASA’s future missions to Mars. He discovered that the public has limited access to the geographic information of our red neighbor.  Because of this, the RedMapper team decided to create a detailed set of maps in the form of an atlas, that draw readers to the otherworldly places of Mars, most of which have yet to be explored. 
Pack Your Bags to Mars with These Rewards
There are several different reward levels. The Mars Atlas is offered as a standalone reward or combined with one year of Mars Portal access. If you only wish to use Mars Portal, access is offered in a lifetime, one year, or a "sneak peak" 30-day option. Both  are offered as individual or classrooms/small groups reward levels, depending on how you wish to use the product. Look for rewards that include the special Mars Poster Pack featuring poster maps of four prominent locations - one of which being the landing site for NASA's 2020 Mars Rover mission... As a bonus, a couple rewards include clues to guide you to special Easter eggs hidden within the map! Read the rewards section to learn more.
Our Launch Equation
All funding acquired through this campaign will be applied to:
Final copy-editing process of The Mars Atlas
  Preparation for publication
  Upgrade mapping software and other tools RedMapper requires so that we can continue to produce these and other useful products on into 2021 and beyond.
  What the Future Holds for Us
Mapping other planets is a huge endeavor. It requires a lot of time, patience, and especially computing power. As RedMapper evolves it will:
Continue to provide Martian map content including The Mars Atlas and Mars Portal
  Significantly improve the resolution of next generation Martian map products (up to 10x resolution!)
  Prepare future editions of The Mars Atlas using this improvement
  Develop an educational curriculum on interplanetary mapping technology and processes to encourage other students and professionals in this important work.
  Present this map work at the 2020 Esri User Conference - the world's largest event dedicated to geographic information system (GIS) technology.
  Join Our Growing Community
Pledge to one or more of The Mars Atlas rewards and own your very own Mars Atlas. Be one of the first 200 Kickstarter contributors to have your name added to a special contributor page, forever memorializing you as a contributor to the ongoing research of our Red neighbor.
  Spread the word on social media and email! The Human species may well be the first life-forms to establish a presence on two planets. Telling your friends and family about RedMapper's hard work and how they also can pledge to this campaign will get us one step closer.
  Visit us at: Instagram — LinkedIn — Facebook 
Thank You from All of Us at Team RedMapper
Thank you so much for visiting our campaign. We have worked very hard on this project and we hope you have been inspired by what you've seen. If you were able to participate, we thank you for your support. It means a lot to us.
Thank you from the RedMapper Team
Campaign page design & strategy by Early Bird Studios

campaign.story:
Lost your keys? Lost your job? Look at the bright side. At least you’re not plagued by pterodactyls, pursued by giant robots, or pestered by zombie poodles. Life is good!
The Things-Could-Be-Worse Mug is designed to remind you how lucky you are.
These mugs are big, giant, jumbo versions of the classic Things-Could-Be-Worse Mugs I introduced on Kickstarter in 2015. People requested larger mugs to help them satisfy big appetites.
These porcelain mugs feature my drawing of a traditional blue-willow paradise discombobulated by more than a dozen calamities, perils, and pests. You’ll find...
              • hairy fiend
              • giant frog
              • pirates
              • cephalopod
              • unpleasant blob creature
              • voracious sea monster
              • UFOs
              • aggressive pterodactyls
              • rambunctious robots
              • zombie poodle
              and other suspicious animals and shrubs.
Details to charm and edify.
What do you get? Sponsors of this Kickstarter project will receive sets of two identical 20-ounce mugs decorated with my multi-calamity drawing. These mugs are made and decorated by the award-winning Kristoff porcelain workshop in Poland using the traditional in-glaze technique. The mugs are food safe, microwave safe, and dishwasher safe so you can use them every day to remind you of all the problems you don’t have. 
A big mug for creatures with big appetites.
The Things-Could-Be-Worse Mug is NOT like those cheap ceramic mugs you get free from the auto body shop or the veterinarian. This is fine porcelain that will enhance your dinner table today and could also delight your descendants for generations.
Comparison of the classic TCBW mug and the new mug.
Things-Could-Be-Worse Mugs make perfect gifts. So, consider getting extras—especially for your coffee-loving friends.
Your Things-Could-Be-Worse Mugs are sure to become treasured family heirlooms cherished for their beauty, utility, and humor. Plus, these mugs help you achieve inner peace by keeping life’s setbacks in perspective and promoting a healthy attitude of gratitude. Things could be worse.
In-glaze porcelain is fired at extra-high temperatures to allow the image to melt slightly into the surface of the plate. Connoisseurs will appreciate the beauty of the in-glaze technique which the artists at Kristoff have been refining since 1831. This is the look of porcelain you see in museums. Sweet.
Quality porcelain like you see in museums.
When will you receive your mugs? I’ve already completed this mug design and inspected multiple samples and approved a production prototype. Production can start as soon as I have enough pledges. Assuming nothing calamitous happens, you should be enjoying your favorite beverage in an amazing mug in August 2020. Probably much sooner.
Where are you? When the rewards are nearly ready to ship, I will send out a Kickstarter address survey. I can’t send you your reward until you send me your current address. So please complete the survey as soon as it is available. If I don’t get your address within 12 months, I'll assume that you no longer have an interest in receiving your reward.
Shipping. Mugs can ship anywhere in the world. Postage charges vary depending on where the package is going. Porcelain is heavy, so postage costs are shockingly high. But for a treasured heirloom that may last generations, you might be able to justify the expense.
Read this if you are outside the U.S. In some countries, customs duties may be applied to reward shipments. I have no way of predicting what customs fees might be and if they’ll apply to your shipment. Customs inspections are very arbitrary and willy-nilly. Most packages sail through without any duty, but some are selected by chance and the recipient gets hit with a duty fee. So if you can’t tolerate the risk that your shipment might get selected for extra costs, you should probably not support this project. Or arrange to have your reward shipped to a friend in the U.S. who can bring you your porcelain in their luggage next trip.
If you are an international sponsor and receive a tracking number when we ship, track your package daily to make sure it doesn’t get hung up in the system and returned to us. Don’t just assume it will show up at your door. Shipments have a way of getting stalled, and monitoring the status of the tracking number allows you to intervene promptly.
 Shipping is provided by our capable and multi-talented partners at Fulfillrite. Our Fulfillrite friends are fast and they do things right the first time.
What’s going on? Sponsors of this project will receive periodic updates through Kickstarter as the project unfolds but not so often that you think I’m a pest.
Questions? Send me your questions and I’ll add them and the answers to the FAQ section at the bottom of this page.
 If you missed my previous Kickstarter projects, you’ll find a few earlier pieces, including the classic Things-Could-Be-Worse Mugs, at Calamityware.com.
Don—Pittsburgh, February 9, 2020
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Countless things could go wrong to delay this project. But the design is done and the pre-production proof has been approved. So if I get enough sponsors, I can green-light production without delay. I’m using a workshop that produces porcelain for monarchs and potentates and has perfected production techniques over 180 years. So technical problems are unlikely. The biggest risk is that production will take longer than anticipated—perhaps because a potentate gets into the production queue ahead of us.

I promise that I won’t stop working until all my sponsors receive their things-could-be-worse mugs.

campaign.story:
The Origin of Idea
We posted our initial designs of Rocket Science based playing cards on our Instagram Channel. The post was received very enthusiastically with tons of messages and comments. That was the point we decided to pursue with full efforts for a Deck of Playing cards on the theme of Rocket Science and SpaceX.
You can see the post here - Instagram Post
How the deck is organized?
The entire deck is themed on Rocket Science and SpaceX. Each Individual suits are sub-themed as follows:-
Hearts: Rocket Science Concepts
13 cards on various fundamental concepts related to Rocket Science. 3 of them shown below.
Clubs: Epic Orbital Rockets 
13 cards on epic orbital rockets of the world. Priority is given on the type of payload and any extra-ordinary features. 3 of them shown below.
Spades: Renowned Scientists and Innovators
13 cards on renowned scientists and innovators who have made significant contributions to the field of Rocket Science. 3 of them shown below.
Diamond: SpaceX, Falcon 9 and Falcon Heavy
13 cards dedicated to Falcon 9, Falcon Heavy and various others tested works of SpaceX. 3 of them shown below.
Jokers
Just in case you got friends(!) who are flat-earthers. You got one card for them! And one card for a person whom we all love a lot - Elon Musk!
Background
We wanted the cards' backside to share the story of the evolution of rockets. A trio of past, present and future images is what we came up with.
Packaging
This is what you will get in your hands -
Quality 
100% plastic (PVC), 310 GSM, 290 microns, Premium printing.
Resistance to bending, tear, and water (ensuring long-term life)
Front side: Matte finish for good grip.
Backside: Semi-glossy, for an aesthetic look.
All this has been discussed with our manufacturing team and actual cards from the portfolio passed the above-mentioned specifications. Feel free to comment/message us for any suggestions or feedback or queries on the above.
Technical Specifications 
We Need Your Support
We need your support and backing to meet the minimum order quantity required for starting the production. Your continuous support in the design of cards and content has already helped in bringing this project to the current stage. On the accomplishment of the Kickstarter goal, we will be able to meet the required cost quoted by the manufacturing team and get the Rocket Deck in your hands.
Any queries - reply promised in 24 hours
Feel free to directly message us on Instagram or simply shoot an email to - spacexfalcontech [at] gmail.com. We promise you of getting your query addressed in 24 hours. Maximum. Any day of the week.
Timeline
Special Thanks 
We would like to take this opportunity to thank two people who connected with us on Instagram and volunteered to help us in this project - 
1. Maÿa Cantú Ledezma, a card collector, and creative artist from Mexico. She helped in deciding the technical specifications, card quality and provided nice design critique.
2. Christian Seiser, a card collector, and designer from Germany. He did extensive design review for some of the cards and helped in fine-tuning of the cards' design.

We have worked through many iterations of design of each card and based on feedback from 1000s of fans on Instagram, finalized the artwork. As with any project, unforeseen events can occur, but we've done everything we can to keep unknown factors to a minimum. 

We are all ears to the feedback from backers and due to that, there could be minor adjustments to the design of cards seen in the above photos.

campaign.story:
Hi, I'm Dave Kellett, and I'm making a hardcover collection of comics called ANATOMY OF AUTHORS! It's a series of goofy literature comics poking fun at all your favorite authors, and now it's time to collect them into a delightful hardcover! 
"Anatomy of Authors" is a hilarious take on High School biology charts...but instead of pointing out where the "thorax" is, we're going to learn truly important things like:
Why does every character name in a Dickens book sound like a weird Pokémon?
Did Shakespeare coin new words by hanging out at the mall?
How did Mark Twain master 1,000 jobs...but never master combing his dang hair? 
These comics are 100% free to read on the site, so check 'em out! Or check out the samples below!
SAMPLE COMICS FROM THE BOOK: 
104-PAGE HARDCOVER BOOK!
PRINTED IN FULL COLOR!
DIMENSIONS: 10 3/4” x 8 1/4” (273mm x 209mm)!
WRAPPED IN A FANCY-SHMANCY CLOTH SPINE!
YOU GUYS...IT'S GONNA LOOK SO NEAT!
* Cover design subject to small changes 
 Want to back the book? Here's a quick guide to rewards you'll get! (And to help, each level calls out the added reward from the previous level!) 
 In addition to the book, higher reward tiers will also be receiving awesome items such as...
Planning on backing at the THE CRITIC'S CHOICE or THE COMPLETIST levels, and would like a piece of SHELDON original comic art? You're welcome to claim *any* SHELDON original in the archives: Just look for comics that don't say "PURCHASED" underneath them in red text on the site. If you would like an ANATOMY OF AUTHORS strip, here is a handy-dandy spreadsheet!   
 We are making the book! Hooray! And now we're shooting to add these stretch goals to your book - at no extra cost to you!! 
Remember Anatomy of Animals? The book turned out great and we intend to duplicate it's look and feel, but with a more literary feel.  
 We're planning to ship your book out in December using USPS. And, because we'll be shipping direct from the studio, each package will be getting a little smooch on its way out the door. EXTRA SMOOCHES FOR YOU, BASICALLY.
A NOTE FOR INTERNATIONAL FRIENDS: We're charging *exactly what it costs us* to ship from the USA. So if you live in London or Sydney or Berlin, the shipping, alas, is what it is. But to help, we made a handy-dandy shipping chart to help your decision, BELOW. Sometimes, going up or down one tier can save you a bit, so it's worth comparing. 
 Dave Kellett is the cartoonist behind the webcomics SHELDON and DRIVE, the co-Director on the comics documentary, STRIPPED, and one of the voices behind the podcast COMICLAB. He's won the Silver Reuben Award for his comics, and twice been nominated for "Best Humor" for the Eisner Award. 
He is currently 5'8" tall.  
LINKS: Sheldon | Drive | Stripped | ComicLab | Twitter | Instagram 
 Directed by: Fred Schroeder
Edited by: Ben Waters

campaign.story:
John Downing was Chief Photographer on the Daily Express with a career that spanned over five decades and took him to over 100 countries and all 7 continents. He not only witnessed natural and man-made disasters, but also war zones and famine; he covered royal tours, political events, the famous and the infamous, the needy and the poor.
He has won numerous awards, including the British Press Photographer of the Year an unprecedented seven times, the United Nations Gold Medal in 1990 and the International Photographer of the Year in 1994 (La Nation, Argentina). 
In 1992 he was honoured with an MBE for ‘Services to Journalism’; in 2001 he was presented with a Lifetime Achievement Award from the UK Picture Editors Guild and in 2011 he received an Honorary Fellowship of The Royal Photographic Society.
Mujahideen Fighters during the Russian invasion of Afghanistan
Queen Elizabeth The Queen Mother, poses for a regimental picture with the Irish Guards, on St. Patrick's Day
Families living on a giant rubbish tip in Brazil
John Downing: Legacy is a long overdue celebration of his illustrious career. Press photographers are often overlooked for their contribution to photography but it is their images that define how we see the world's events unfolding on a daily basis. John Downing's work is right there at the pinnacle of photojournalism.
Mother Teresa
The Beatles at the Sgt Pepper album launch
Deer Stalking in Scotland
This is an important book demonstrating that despite the pressures John worked under, he produced quality photographs time after time. Every day press photographers are given an assignment with the challenge of capturing images that will immediately reflect what is happening - be it a war zone, disaster or a striking portrait of a personality. Success is often measured by claiming the front page - something John managed on many occasions.
A landmine victim in hospital, Bosnia
Sophia Loren in her Paris apartment
The Queen during the State Opening of Parliament
John Downing: Legacy covers some of his key assignments, including most major wars and international events. He travelled to East Pakistan/Bangladesh, Rhodesia, Beirut, Iraq, Somalia, Rwanda, Croatia, and over a dozen visits to Bosnia.
He was beaten and imprisoned in Uganda by the regime of Idi Amin. The Daily Express described its front-page headline as, 'World exclusive pictures taken inside the black hole of Kampala'.
Inside the Kampala Prison
Together with writer Kim Willsher, John was one of the first journalists to visit Chernobyl after the nuclear explosion.
A mother holds her dying son, believed to be a Chernobyl victim
He lived rough for many weeks with guerrilla fighters in several wars; the Anyanya in Southern Sudan, the Contras in Nicaragua, and the Mujahideen in Afghanistan.
Afghan Warrior
A Russian tank enters Kabul
Rwandan refugees
And - as the video cryptically refers - he was the only photographer inside the Grand Hotel, Brighton, when the IRA bomb exploded in a failed attempt to kill PM Margaret Thatcher and her government. This led to further world exclusive photographs.
Inside the Grand Hotel, Brighton, seconds after the bomb exploded
Amongst all these key images were thousands of others; royalty, street scenes, celebrations, landscapes - occasionally with a humorous take. All in a day's work for one of our finest photographers. This book is his legacy.
Rotten Row, Hyde Park, London
Prince Andrew shares a joke with fellow helicopter pilots
Princess Diana leaves hospital with newborn Prince Harry
Families sleeping on the streets of Kolkata (formally Calcutta)
Reward Prints
Reward print #1 - Skinhead arrested in Southend
Reward print #2 - Russian soldier on duty in Kabul
Reward print #3 - Battersea Power Station in the snow
Reward print #4 - Back to work after the Millennium celebrations, 3rd January 2000
The Book
John Downing: Legacy will be a hardback book with dust jacket, size 270 x 290mm (landscape) and 192 pages.

updates.update_userinfo: Being Inbetween - a brilliant new Kickstarter
updates.update_content:
I am Colin Wilkinson, the publisher behind Bluecoat Press, and am very proud to have had the opportunity through your support to bring into the world books like John Downing's Legacy, Jim Mortram's Small Town Inertia, Tish Murtha'sYouth Unemployment and Mik Critchlow's Coal Town amongst many others. These are all books that change the way we see the world.
I am committed to British social-documentary photography and photojournalism, which is amongst the finest in the world - and have been lucky to work with some brilliant photographers. I have now launched another project - with multi-award winning photographer (and you will see why when you look at her project) Carolyn Mendelsohn. Her theme is a universal one - tackling that profoundly complicated time for young girls aged between 10 and 12 as they transition from childhood to adulthood.

It is with great sadness that we announce that John Downing passed away last week. When we published Legacy, we knew it was a battle against time and thanks to you, we raised the funds and produced a book that John was truly proud of. He really did feel it represented his life's work and it was an immense privilege to launch the book at the London Welsh Club in London with his beloved London Welsh Choir in full voice. Below is my video of John wearing the famous red jacket, flanked by his two brothers Andrew and David and accompanied on piano by his wife, Anita.

updates.update_userinfo: A new Kickstarter: Tish Murtha's Juvenile Jazz Bands
updates.update_content:
Thank you all for supporting John Downing's Legacy. I hope you all appreciated this important retrospective of John's brilliant work. 
Today we are launching on Kickstarter the third volume of Tish Murtha's fabulous Newcastle work. In fact, Juvenile Jazz Bands was her first major project, preceding both Youth Unemployment and Elswick Kids - and resulted in her first exhibition at Side Gallery.
Juvenile Jazz Bands is trademark Tish. She operated best on her home ground where her close affinity with her young subjects shines through and her photographs are imbued with empathy and humour in spite of the decaying urban setting. For everyone who backed and , is an essential purchase to complete a remarkable trilogy.

I had the privilege to interview John Downing the day after the Kickstarter campaign for his book, Legacy, was launched in August 2019. The plan was to create content to help drive momentum for the campaign. There was no need, seven hours after the launch, the funding target was  breached. By the time I met John it had doubled - the day became a celebration. I thought it might be nice to share, you can read about my time with John and his wife Anita HERE 
Best wishes,
